body:
Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. üéâ
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! üçµ
I tried the latest version of echarts(4.5), and the problem is still exist

Yes, I have identified the bug
https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/blob/master/src/contain/text.js#L119
It should be `x += width`
Faced the same problem. Setting the `dimension` to 2 and mapping by extraValue didn't work for me. This way only the color of item dots is changing but the series line color remains the default.
@jbadilla you can use `layoutIterations: 0` to disable it, and apparently order is preserved.

@100pah Could this feature be implemented in cases where a chart uses [dataset](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#dataset.source) structured as a 2d array? Then the mapping to CSV would be straightforward using [an approach like this arrayToCSV](https://gist.github.com/yangshun/01b81762e8d30f0d7f8f) example.
I think rearrange [here](https://github.com/ecomfe/zrender/blob/master/src/contain/text.js#L196-L217) would fix the problem
Similar to #11805

It's an expected behaviour. But I think this can be further discussed because current behaviour is a bit confusing in the scene of `xAxis`. 

Hi @susiwen8 The calculation in the zrender is not a bug. By default the text is set to align left. If the align is changed to right. It should be moved to left by `width` pixels.

It's an expected behavior. The `insideXXX` position is designed for the shape which can contain the label. And `insideRight` will be aligned to the right of shape edge. 

If you wan't to position the label on the right. Use `right`

@alex2wong ÊàëÁúã‰∫Ü‰∏ãÔºåÂ∫îËØ•ÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ symbol ËÆæÁΩÆÁöÑÊ†ºÂºèÊúâÁÇπÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ËøòÊòØÁî®ÁöÑÁôΩËâ≤ÊñπÂùóÁªòÂà∂„ÄÇ

ÂõæÁâáÁöÑ symbol Â∫îËØ•ËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫ 

```js
symbol: 'image://' + lineSymbol
```

ÊàëËØï‰∫Ü‰∏ãËøôÊ†∑Â∫îËØ•Â∞±Ê≤°ÈóÆÈ¢ò‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. üéâ
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

What do you mean by grid? If it's [grid](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid), then it's [grid.left](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid.left), [grid.right](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid.right), [grid.top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid.top), [grid.bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid.bottom).
